description:
'''Dream pop''' is a subgenre of [[alternative rock]] and [[neo-psychedelia]] that emphasizes atmosphere and sonic texture as strongly as it does [[pop music|pop]] melody. Common characteristics include breathy vocals, dense productions, and effects such as [[reverb]], [[echo]], [[tremolo (electronic effect)|tremolo]], and [[chorus (audio effect)|chorus]].  It often overlaps with the related genre of [[shoegaze]], and the two genre terms have at times been used interchangeably.

Emerging in the 1980s, the term "dreampop" was coined by the duo [[A.R. Kane]] to describe their music, they were signed to the UK independent record label [[4AD]], alongside other early dream pop acts such as [[Cocteau Twins]], and [[This Mortal Coil]]. During the late 1980s to early 1990s, the genre saw further proliferation through UK-based artists such as [[My Bloody Valentine (band)|My Bloody Valentine]], [[Slowdive]], and [[Lush (band)|Lush]] alongside US-based acts [[Galaxie 500]], [[Julee Cruise]], and [[Mazzy Star]]. By the late 2000s, the sound saw renewed popularity among [[millennial]] listeners through bands such as [[Beach House (band)|Beach House]].
